summary.long: Titus is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text: Paul, a bond-servant of God and an apostle of Jesus Christ, for the faith of those chosen of God and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in the hope of eternal life, which God, who cannot lie, promised long ages ago,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but at the proper time revealed His word in the proclamation with which I was entrusted according to the commandment of God our Savior;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To Titus, my true son in a common faith: Grace and peace from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Savior.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I left you in Crete, that you would set in order what remains and appoint elders in every city as I directed you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: namely, if any man is beyond reproach, the husband of one wife, having children who believe, not accused of indecent behavior or rebellion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the overseer must be beyond reproach as God’s steward, not self-willed, not quick-tempered, not overindulging in wine, not a bully, not greedy for money,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but hospitable, loving what is good, self-controlled, righteous, holy, disciplined,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: holding firmly the faithful word which is in accordance with the teaching, so that he will be able both to exhort in sound doctrine and to refute those who contradict it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For there are many rebellious people, empty talkers and deceivers, especially those of the circumcision,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who must be silenced because they are upsetting whole families, teaching things they should not teach for the sake of dishonest gain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of them, a prophet of their own, said, “Cretans are always liars, evil beasts, lazy gluttons.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This testimony is true. For this reason reprimand them severely so that they may be sound in the faith,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not paying attention to Jewish myths and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure, but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They profess to know God, but by their deeds they deny Him, being detestable and disobedient and worthless for any good deed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as for you, proclaim the things which are fitting for sound doctrine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Older men are to be temperate, dignified, self-controlled, sound in faith, in love, in perseverance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Older women likewise are to be reverent in their behavior, not malicious gossips nor enslaved to much wine, teaching what is good,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that they may encourage the young women to love their husbands, to love their children,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to be sensible, pure, workers at home, kind, being subject to their own husbands, so that the word of God will not be dishonored.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Likewise urge the young men to be sensible;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in all things show yourself to be an example of good deeds, with purity in doctrine, dignified,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: sound in speech which is beyond reproach, so that the opponent will be put to shame, having nothing bad to say about us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Urge slaves to be subject to their own masters in everything, to be pleasing, not argumentative,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not stealing, but showing all good faith so that they will adorn the doctrine of God our Savior in every respect.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the grace of God has appeared, bringing salvation to all people,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: instructing us to deny ungodliness and worldly desires and to live sensibly, righteously, and in a godly manner in the present age,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: looking for the blessed hope and the appearing of the glory of our great God and Savior, Christ Jesus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who gave Himself for us to redeem us from every lawless deed, and to purify for Himself a people for His own possession, eager for good deeds.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things speak and exhort, and rebuke with all authority. No one is to disregard you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remind them to be subject to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready for every good deed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to slander no one, not to be contentious, to be gentle, showing every consideration for all people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we too were once foolish, disobedient, deceived, enslaved to various lusts and pleasures, spending our life in malice and envy, hateful, hating one another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the kindness of God our Savior and His love for mankind appeared,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He saved us, not on the basis of deeds which we did in righteousness, but in accordance with His mercy, by the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: whom He richly poured out upon us through Jesus Christ our Savior,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that being justified by His grace we would be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This statement is trustworthy; and concerning these things I want you to speak confidently, so that those who have believed God will be careful to engage in good deeds. These things are good and beneficial for people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But avoid foolish controversies and genealogies and strife and disputes about the Law, for they are useless and worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Reject a divisive person after a first and second warning,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: knowing that such a person has deviated from what is right and is sinning, being self-condemned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I send Artemas or Tychicus to you, make every effort to come to me at Nicopolis, for I have decided to spend the winter there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Diligently help Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their way so that nothing is lacking for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our people must also learn to engage in good deeds to meet pressing needs, so that they will not be unproductive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who are with me greet you. Greet those who love us in the faith.
Grace be with you all.
verses.speaker: Narrator
